intro: Polypodium furcatum, commonly known as the sword fern, is a species of epiphytic and terrestrial fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its sword-shaped fronds that are typically 30–100 cm long. The plant has a rhizome that is often forked, giving it its scientific name "furcatum," which means "forked" in Latin. It thrives in humid environments and requires indirect light and well-draining soil. Polypodium furcatum is popular as a decorative plant due to its elegant appearance and ease of care.
